intro: Jumellea anjouanensis, commonly known as the Anjouan starfish, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Anjouan in the Comoros archipelago. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers and woody stems, adapted to the island's unique climate. It thrives in coastal limestone soils and is often found in rocky, well-drained habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
